data.chText: （尤指希望发生的事的）可能性
data.enText: a possibility of sth happening, especially sth that you want

data.chText: 有可能弄到今晚的票吗？
data.enText: Is there any chance of getting tickets for tonight?

data.chText: 她通过考试的希望很渺茫。
data.enText: She has only a slim chance of passing the exam.

data.chText: 他及时赶回来的可能性不大。
data.enText: There's a slight chance that he'll be back in time.

data.chText: 他不可能改变主意。
data.enText: There is no chance that he will change his mind.

data.chText: 找到生还者的希望有多大？
data.enText: What chance is there of anybody being found alive?

data.chText: 如今早产儿成活的希望非常大。
data.enText: Nowadays a premature baby has a very good chance of survival.

data.chText: 这次手术成功的可能性是50%。
data.enText: The operation has a fifty-fifty chance of success.

data.chText: 遭雷击的可能性是微乎其微的。
data.enText: The chances are a million to one against being struck by lightning.

data.chText: 非常小的可能性
data.enText: an outside chance (= a very small one)

data.chText: 机会；机遇；时机
data.enText: a suitable time or situation when you have the opportunity to do sth

data.chText: 我们今年不会再有机会度假了。
data.enText: We won't get another chance of a holiday this year.

data.chText: 请给我一个解释的机会。
data.enText: Please give me a chance to explain.

data.chText: 那正是她一直等待的机会。
data.enText: It was the chance she had been waiting for.

data.chText: 家长将有机会参观学校。
data.enText: There will be a chance for parents to look around the school.

data.chText: 杰夫已骗过我一次，我不会再给他机会。
data.enText: Jeff deceived me once already─I won't give him a second chance .

data.chText: 这是你成功的大好机会。
data.enText: This is your big chance (= opportunity for success) .

data.chText: 今晚是你在本地剧院看上这出戏的最后一次机会。
data.enText: Tonight is your last chance to catch the play at your local theatre.

data.chText: 风险；冒险
data.enText: an unpleasant or dangerous possibility

data.chText: 安装电器设备时千万不要冒险，弄错了有可能会出人命的。
data.enText: When installing electrical equipment don't take any chances . A mistake could kill.

data.chText: 偶然；碰巧；意外
data.enText: the way that some things happen without any cause that you can see or understand

data.chText: 我碰巧在机场遇见她。
data.enText: I met her by chance (= without planning to) at the airport.

data.chText: 国际象棋不是靠运气取胜的。
data.enText: Chess is not a game of chance .

data.chText: 我们俩当时都在场纯属巧合。
data.enText: It was pure chance that we were both there.

data.chText: 我们将非常周密地筹划一切，决不留任何纰漏。
data.enText: We'll plan everything very carefully and leave nothing to chance .
as chance would have it

data.chText: 凑巧；碰巧
data.enText: happening in a way that was lucky, although it was not planned

data.chText: 赶巧约翰也去伦敦，所以我跟他一块儿去了。
data.enText: As chance would have it, John was going to London too, so I went with him.
be in with a chance (of doing sth)

data.chText: 有可能成功；有机会获得
data.enText: to have the possibility of succeeding or achieving sth

data.chText: “你认为我们会获胜吗？”“我觉得有可能。”
data.enText: ‘Do you think we'll win?’ ‘I think we're in with a chance.’

data.chText: 他大有可能考试合格。
data.enText: He's in with a good chance of passing the exam.
by any chance

data.chText: （尤用于问句，询问是否真实、可能等）或许，可能
data.enText: used especially in questions, to ask whether sth is true, possible, etc.

data.chText: 你爱上他了？
data.enText: Are you in love with him, by any chance?
the chances are (that)…

data.chText: 可能…
data.enText: it is likely that…

data.chText: 你可能不用付钱。
data.enText: The chances are you won't have to pay.
chance would be a fine thing

data.chText: 苦于没有机会
data.enText: people say chance would be a fine thing to show that they would like to do or have the thing that sb has mentioned, but that they do not think that it is very likely
give sb/sth half a chance

data.chText: 给…一些机会
data.enText: to give sb/sth some opportunity to do sth

data.chText: 只要一有机会，那条狗就会狠咬你一口。
data.enText: That dog will give you a nasty bite, given half a chance.
no chance

data.chText: 不可能
data.enText: there is no possibility

data.chText: “你认为他会做这事吗？”“不可能。”
data.enText: ‘Do you think he'll do it?’ ‘No chance.’
on the off chance (that)

data.chText: 抱（一线）希望；碰碰运气
data.enText: because of the possibility of sth happening, although it is unlikely

data.chText: 我想你不会在家，只是碰碰运气顺路来看一下。
data.enText: I didn't think you'd be at home but I just called by on the off chance.
stand a chance (of doing sth)

data.chText: 有可能成功；有机会获得
data.enText: to have the possibility of succeeding or achieving sth

data.chText: 司机没有来得及刹车。
data.enText: The driver didn't stand a chance of stopping in time.
take a chance (on sth)

data.chText: 冒险
data.enText: to decide to do sth, knowing that it might be the wrong choice

data.chText: 我们怀着天气可能会好的侥幸心理筹划到户外聚会。
data.enText: We took a chance on the weather and planned to have the party outside.
take your chances

data.chText: 碰运气
data.enText: to take a risk or to use the opportunities that you have and hope that things will happen in the way that you want

data.chText: 他冒险跳进水里。
data.enText: He took his chances and jumped into the water.

data.id-g-sent: not have/stand a cat in hell's chance

data.enText: not have a dog's chance

data.chText: 毫无机会；绝无可能
data.enText: to have no chance at all

data.chText: 他根本不可能通过这次考试。
data.enText: He hasn't a dog's chance of passing the exam.

data.id-g-sent: with an eye for/to the main chance

data.enText: a fighting chance

data.chText: 要努力奋斗才有的一线成功机会
data.enText: a small chance of being successful if a great effort is made
not have a snowball's chance in hell

data.chText: 根本不可能；毫无机会
data.enText: to have no chance at all
a sporting chance

data.chText: 比较有成功希望的机会
data.enText: a reasonable chance of success

data.chText: 冒险；拿…去冒风险
data.enText: to risk sth, although you know the result may not be successful

data.chText: 她无照驾车，完全是在冒险。
data.enText: She was chancing her luck driving without a licence.

data.chText: “带上伞吧。”“不带，我就冒冒险吧。”
data.enText: ‘Take an umbrella.’ ‘No, I'll chance it (= take the risk that it may rain) .’

data.chText: 我躲了起来，不能冒险出去。
data.enText: I stayed hidden; I couldn't chance coming out.

data.chText: 偶然发生；碰巧
data.enText: to happen or to do sth by chance

data.chText: 要是我真的碰巧发现她的行踪，会立即通知你的。
data.enText: If I do chance to find out where she is, I'll inform you immediately.

data.chText: 他们碰巧住在同一家旅馆。
data.enText: They chanced to be staying at the same hotel.

data.chText: 碰巧他们住在同一家旅馆。
data.enText: It chanced (that) they were staying at the same hotel.
chance your arm

data.chText: 冒险一试；碰碰运气
data.enText: to take a risk although you will probably fail
chance on/upon sb/sth

data.chText: 偶然发现；碰巧遇到
data.enText: to find or meet sb/sth unexpectedly or by chance

data.chText: 有一天他偶然发现了埃玛的日记，便开始读了起来。
data.enText: One day he chanced upon Emma's diary and began reading it.

data.chText: 意外的；偶然的；碰巧的
data.enText: not planned

data.chText: 邂逅
data.enText: a chance meeting/encounter

data.text: luck ♦ chance ♦ coincidence ♦ accident ♦ fortune ♦ fate ♦ destiny ♦ providence

data.chText: 以上各词均指机遇、命运、运气。
data.enText: These are all words for things that happen or the force that causes them to happen.
luck

data.chText: 指机遇、命运、运气：
data.enText: the force that causes good or bad things to happen to people

data.chText: 这戒指总是给我带来好运。
data.enText: This ring has always brought me good luck.
chance

data.chText: 指偶然、碰巧、意外：
data.enText: the way that some things happen without any cause that you can see or understand

data.chText: 这结果可能纯属意外。
data.enText: The results could simply be due to chance.
coincidence

data.chText: 指出人意料的巧合、巧事：
data.enText: the fact of two things happening at the same time by chance, in a surprising way

data.chText: 他们因一连串奇妙的巧合而相遇。
data.enText: They met through a series of strange coincidences.
accident

data.chText: 指意外、偶然的事：
data.enText: something that happens unexpectedly and is not planned in advance

data.chText: 他们早到仅仅是偶然而已。
data.enText: Their early arrival was just an accident.
fortune

data.chText: 尤指影响人生的机会、运气：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) luck or chance, especially in the way it affects people's lives

data.chText: 只有那次我们运气好，那一天阳光普照。
data.enText: For once, fortune was on our side: the sun shone that day.
fate

data.chText: 指命运、天数、定数、天意：
data.enText: the power that is believed to control everything that happens and that cannot be stopped or changed

data.chText: 命中注定她永远到不了美国。
data.enText: Fate decreed that she would never reach America.
destiny

data.chText: 指主宰事物的力量、命运之神：
data.enText: the power that is believed to control events

data.chText: 我总认为有某种力量在指引着我们——叫它上帝也罢，天意也罢，还是命运也罢。
data.enText: I believe there's some force guiding us─call it God, destiny or fate.
providence

data.chText: 指上帝、苍天、天佑：
data.enText: ( formal ) God, or a force that some people believe controls our lives and the things that happen to us, usually in a way that protects us

data.chText: 他相信上苍。
data.enText: He trusted in divine providence.

data.chText: 用fate、destiny还是providence？
一般认为providence是善意的，即使降临苦难也是上帝安排的一部分；fate有时是善意的，但那只是意外的恩赐；同样经常地，fate也是残酷的，使人感到无能为力；destiny更可能给人力量的感觉，具有强烈使命感的人通常认为自己是天生伟大或成就伟大事业的人。
data.enText: Providence is usually seen as being kind: even when it sends suffering, this is accepted as being part of God's plan. Fate can be kind, but this is an unexpected gift; just as often, fate is cruel and makes people feel helpless. Destiny is more likely to give people a sense of power: people who have a strong sense of destiny usually believe that they are meant to be great or do great things.
fate, destiny or providence?
by/through …luck/chance/coincidence/accident
It was… luck/chance/coincidence/accident/fortune/fate/providence that…
It's no coincidence/accident that…
pure/sheer/mere luck/chance/coincidence/accident
good/bad/ill luck/fortune
to have the … luck/fortune to do sth
to tempt fate/providence (= to do sth too confidently in a way that might mean that your good luck will come to an end)
sb's luck/fortune changes/turns
a stroke of luck/fortune/fate
a twist of fortune/fate

means: (尤指希望发生的事的)可能性

ex.chText: 他们没有逃跑的机会。
ex.enText: They had no opportunity/chance to escape.

ex.chText: 他获得了访问巴黎的机会。
ex.enText: He has got the opportunity/chance to visit Paris.

ex.chText: 对去年的毕业生而言，就业机会要多一些。
ex.enText: There were more opportunities for graduates last year.

synonyms.bx: 指能够做某事或容易做成某事的机会，作此义解时常可与 chance 换用；也可指得到工作或提升的机会。

ex.chText: 这是他唯一的逃脱机会。
ex.enText: It was his only chance of escape.

ex.chText: 我从不错过任何踢足球的机会。
ex.enText: I never miss a chance to play football.

ex.chText: 他将是下周竞选的候选人，这是他成功的大好机会。
ex.enText: He will be a candidate in next week's election, and this is his big chance.

synonyms.bx: 指做想做之事的适当时机，侧重指偶然或意外的机会。

ex.chText: 这是个举国欢庆的时刻。
ex.enText: This is an occasion for the whole country to celebrate.

ex.chText: 这是两位总统表达友谊的时机。
ex.enText: It was the occasion for expressing friendship by the two presidents.

synonyms.bx: 指合适的机会或有利的时机，通常用单数，常后接介词 for。

ex.chText: 现在正是我们搬到纽约去的好时机。
ex.enText: Now is the right time for us to move to New York.

ex.chText: 如果有时间我会去拜访她。
ex.enText: I'll visit her if I have time.

ex.chText: 现在不是换工作的时候。
ex.enText: This is no time to switch jobs.

synonyms.bx: 指能够用来做某事的一段时间，多用于口语。

ex.chText: 他还是小孩子的时候，从不敢在晚上外出。
ex.enText: He never ventured out at night when he was a child.

ex.chText: 有人在敲门，她犹豫了一下，然后大着胆子下楼，走向门口。
ex.enText: Someone was knocking, and she paused before venturing downstairs to the door.

ex.chText: 你冒险这样做很大胆。
ex.enText: It's very bold of you to venture to do so.

synonyms.bx: 指冒风险试一试，或是去可能会有危险的地方，或是做有风险的事。

ex.chText: 那个逃跑的奴隶决定留在山洞里，因为他不敢冒险被人发现。
ex.enText: The runaway slave decided to stay in the cave because he couldn't chance being found.

ex.chText: 他不知道另一条路线是不是能节省更多的时间，但是他决定冒一下险。
ex.enText: He was not sure if another route could save him more time, but he decided to chance it.

synonyms.bx: 指做自己觉得可能有风险的事情。

ex.chText: 粗心大意的驾驶者拿乘客和自己的生命冒险。
ex.enText: Careless drivers hazard passengers' lives as well as their own.

ex.chText: 我不想冒险猜测。
ex.enText: I wouldn't like to hazard a guess.

synonyms.bx: 指为获得某物而冒失去钱财等的风险，也指冒险猜测、建议等。

ex.chText: 难道你不认为吸烟者其实是在拿自己的健康去冒险吗？
ex.enText: Don't you think that smokers are actually risking their own health?

ex.chText: 那名政客准备不惜一切来避免离婚。
ex.enText: That politician has prepared to risk everything to avoid divorce.

ex.chText: 如果不能得到那笔贷款，他们就有可能失去公司。
ex.enText: If they cannot get that loan, they may risk losing the company.

ex.chText: 你可以编个迟到的理由，但我不想冒这个险。
ex.enText: You could make up a reason for being late, but I wouldn't risk it.

synonyms.bx: 指使遭受失去、毁坏、伤害等风险或承担此类风险去做某事，也指做有危险或不好结果的事。

d: 使…冒风险；冒…的风险；冒险做

data.enText: as chance would have it

data.chText: 凑巧；碰巧
data.enText: happening in a way that was lucky, although it was not planned

data.chText: 赶巧约翰也去伦敦，所以我跟他一块儿去了。
data.enText: As chance would have it, John was going to London too, so I went with him.
be in with a chance (of doing sth)

data.chText: 有可能成功；有机会获得
data.enText: to have the possibility of succeeding or achieving sth

data.chText: “你认为我们会获胜吗？”“我觉得有可能。”
data.enText: ‘Do you think we'll win?’ ‘I think we're in with a chance.’

data.chText: 他大有可能考试合格。
data.enText: He's in with a good chance of passing the exam.
by any chance

data.chText: （尤用于问句，询问是否真实、可能等）或许，可能
data.enText: used especially in questions, to ask whether sth is true, possible, etc.

data.chText: 你爱上他了？
data.enText: Are you in love with him, by any chance?
the chances are (that)…

data.chText: 可能…
data.enText: it is likely that…

data.chText: 你可能不用付钱。
data.enText: The chances are you won't have to pay.
chance would be a fine thing

data.chText: 苦于没有机会
data.enText: people say chance would be a fine thing to show that they would like to do or have the thing that sb has mentioned, but that they do not think that it is very likely
give sb/sth half a chance

data.chText: 给…一些机会
data.enText: to give sb/sth some opportunity to do sth

data.chText: 只要一有机会，那条狗就会狠咬你一口。
data.enText: That dog will give you a nasty bite, given half a chance.
no chance

data.chText: 不可能
data.enText: there is no possibility

data.chText: “你认为他会做这事吗？”“不可能。”
data.enText: ‘Do you think he'll do it?’ ‘No chance.’
on the off chance (that)

data.chText: 抱（一线）希望；碰碰运气
data.enText: because of the possibility of sth happening, although it is unlikely

data.chText: 我想你不会在家，只是碰碰运气顺路来看一下。
data.enText: I didn't think you'd be at home but I just called by on the off chance.
stand a chance (of doing sth)

data.chText: 有可能成功；有机会获得
data.enText: to have the possibility of succeeding or achieving sth

data.chText: 司机没有来得及刹车。
data.enText: The driver didn't stand a chance of stopping in time.
take a chance (on sth)

data.chText: 冒险
data.enText: to decide to do sth, knowing that it might be the wrong choice

data.chText: 我们怀着天气可能会好的侥幸心理筹划到户外聚会。
data.enText: We took a chance on the weather and planned to have the party outside.
take your chances

data.chText: 碰运气
data.enText: to take a risk or to use the opportunities that you have and hope that things will happen in the way that you want

data.chText: 他冒险跳进水里。
data.enText: He took his chances and jumped into the water.
not have/stand a cat in hell's chance (of doing sth)

data.chText: 毫无机会
data.enText: to have no chance at all
not have a dog's chance

data.chText: 毫无机会；绝无可能
data.enText: to have no chance at all

data.chText: 他根本不可能通过这次考试。
data.enText: He hasn't a dog's chance of passing the exam.
have an even chance (of doing sth)

data.chText: （做某事）有一半的机会；正反各半的可能性
data.enText: to be equally likely to do or not do sth

data.chText: 她明天多半会赢。
data.enText: She has more than an even chance of winning tomorrow.
with an eye for/on/to the main chance

data.chText: 瞅机会捞一把
data.enText: with the hope of using a particular situation in order to gain some advantage for yourself
(a) fat chance (of sth/doing sth)

data.chText: 不大可能发生
data.enText: used for saying that you do not believe sth is likely to happen

data.chText: “他们也许会让我们免票入场。”“别痴心妄想了！”
data.enText: ‘They might let us in without tickets.’ ‘Fat chance of that!’
a fighting chance

data.chText: 要努力奋斗才有的一线成功机会
data.enText: a small chance of being successful if a great effort is made
not have a snowball's chance in hell

data.chText: 根本不可能；毫无机会
data.enText: to have no chance at all
a sporting chance

data.chText: 比较有成功希望的机会
data.enText: a reasonable chance of success
chance your arm

data.chText: 冒险一试；碰碰运气
data.enText: to take a risk although you will probably fail
chance on/upon sb/sth

data.chText: 偶然发现；碰巧遇到
data.enText: to find or meet sb/sth unexpectedly or by chance

data.chText: 有一天他偶然发现了埃玛的日记，便开始读了起来。
data.enText: One day he chanced upon Emma's diary and began reading it.

example: you take a chance when you let her drive

tr: a measure of how likely it is that some event will occur
a number expressing the ratio of favorable cases to the whole number of cases possible
example: the probability that an unbiased coin will fall with the head up is 0.5

tr: an unknown and unpredictable phenomenon that causes an event to result one way rather than another
example: we ran into each other by pure chance
his prospects as a writer are excellent

tr: a possibility due to a favorable combination of circumstances
example: the holiday gave us the opportunity to visit Washington

tr: come upon, as if by accident
example: We find this idea in Plato
I happened upon the most wonderful bakery not very far from here
She chanced upon an interesting book in the bookstore the other day

tr: take a risk in the hope of a favorable outcome
example: When you buy these stocks you are gambling
I chanced to meet my old friend in the street

value.def: If there is a chance of something happening, it is possible that it will happen.

example.ex: Do you think they have a chance of beating Australia?...
example.tran: 你认为他们有可能击败澳大利亚吗？

example.ex: This partnership has a good chance of success...
example.tran: 这个组合获胜的希望很大。

example.ex: The specialist who carried out the brain scan thought Tim's chances of survival were still slim...
example.tran: 给蒂姆做脑部扫描的专科医生认为他活下来的可能性仍旧渺茫。

example.ex: There was really very little chance that Ben would ever have led a normal life.
example.tran: 本过上正常人的生活的机会真的非常小。

value.def: If you have a chance to do something, you have the opportunity to do it.

example.ex: The electoral council announced that all eligible people would get a chance to vote...
example.tran: 选举委员会宣布，所有有资格者都将获得投票的机会。

example.ex: Most refugee doctors never get the chance to practice medicine in British hospitals...
example.tran: 多数去避难的医生永远没有机会在英国医院行医。

example.ex: I felt I had to give him a chance.
example.tran: 我觉得自己必须给他个机会。

gramarinfo.label: usu N to-inf, N <l>for</l> n to-inf

value.def: A chance meeting or event is one that is not planned or expected.

example.ex: ...a chance meeting.
example.tran: 偶遇

example.ex: ...a victim of chance and circumstance.
example.tran: 时运不济的倒霉蛋

value.def: If you chance to do something or chance on something, you do it or find it although you had not planned or tried to.

example.ex: A man I chanced to meet proved to be a most unusual character...
example.tran: 我邂逅了一个人，后来发现他是个极为与众不同的家伙。

example.ex: It was just then that I chanced to look round.
example.tran: 就在那时，我恰好环顾了下四周。

example.ex: ...Christopher Columbus, who chanced upon the Dominican Republic nearly 500 years ago.
example.tran: 克里斯托弗·哥伦布，在近500年前偶然发现多米尼加共和国的人

value.def: If you chance something, you do it even though there is a risk that you may not succeed or that something bad may happen.

example.ex: Andy knew the risks. I cannot believe he would have chanced it...
example.tran: 安迪知道有风险，我不敢相信他竟然甘冒其险。

example.ex: He decided no assassin would chance a shot from amongst that crowd.
example.tran: 他认定，没有刺客会冒险混在人群里开枪。

value.def: Something that happens by chance was not planned by anyone.

example.ex: He had met Mr Maude by chance.
example.tran: 他曾邂逅过莫德先生。

gramarinfo.label: PHR after v, PHR with cl

value.def: You can use by any chance when you are asking questions in order to find out whether something that you think might be true is actually true.

example.ex: Are they by any chance related?
example.tran: 他们有可能是亲戚吗？

gramarinfo.label: PHR with cl (not first in cl)

value.tran: (用以询问某事是否属实)会不会，可能

value.def: If you say that someone stands a chance of achieving something, you mean that they are likely to achieve it. If you say that someone doesn't stand a chance of achieving something, you mean that they cannot possibly achieve it.

example.ex: Being very good at science subjects, I stood a good chance of gaining high grades...
example.tran: 我理科很棒，所以很有机会拿高分。

example.ex: Neither is seen as standing any chance of snatching the leadership from him.
example.tran: 两人都不被认为有任何可能从他手中夺得领导权。

value.def: When you take a chance, you try to do something although there is a large risk of danger or failure.

example.ex: You take a chance on the weather if you holiday in the UK...
example.tran: 在英国度假，只有赌天气了。

example.ex: From then on, they were taking no chances...
example.tran: 从那时起，他们就不再冒险了。

example.ex: Dennis was not a man to take chances.
example.tran: 丹尼斯不是个敢冒风险的人。

trans: (用以询问某事是否属实)会不会，可能；万一
再爱一次；天上智喜；再给我一次机会；再一次机会；再爱一场
